FuncDef:
The ipv6 nd dad timeout command sets a timeout period for duplicate address detection (DAD) messages.
The undo ipv6 nd dad timeout command restores the default timeout period for DAD messages.
The default timeout period is 1 second for DAD messages.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a timeout period for DAD messages.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 60, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If many VLANs are configured on a VLAN tag termination sub-interface, DAD messages may fail to be transmitted within the default timeout period (1s). To resolve this issue, run the ipv6 nd dad timeout command to prolong the timeout period for DAD messages.
Prerequisites
IPv6 has been enabled using the ipv6 enable command in the interface view.
